challenges.title: Password Policy Violation
challenges.description: Review the password 'Password123!' and identify what makes it weak according to security best practices.
hints: The base word is very common
Adding numbers and symbols to common words doesn't make them secure
Attackers often try common words with simple modifications

challenges.title: Password Strength Analysis
challenges.description: Evaluate the password 'Tr0ub4dor&3' and suggest the main improvement needed.
hints: Length is more important than complexity
Longer passwords are exponentially harder to crack
Consider using a passphrase instead

challenges.title: Hash Cracking Challenge
challenges.description: Crack this MD5 hash: 5d41402abc4b2a76b9719d911017c592. What is the original password?
hints: Try using an online MD5 cracker
This is a very common word
MD5 is cryptographically broken and should not be used

challenges.title: Multi-Factor Authentication
challenges.description: What is the most secure second factor for MFA that doesn't rely on SMS or phone calls?
hints: SMS and phone calls can be intercepted
Physical devices are harder to compromise
FIDO2 standard provides the highest security

challenges.title: Digital Footprint Analysis
challenges.description: Using the username 'cyberpirate2024', find which social media platform they're most active on. Search carefully through public sources.
hints: Try searching the username on different platforms
Look for the platform with the most recent activity
Check multiple social media sites

challenges.title: Geolocation Challenge

hints: Look for distinctive architectural features
The clock tower is world-famous
This is the capital city of England

challenges.title: Company Intelligence

hints: Check the university's official website

challenges.title: Caesar Cipher Decode
challenges.description: Decrypt this Caesar cipher (shift of 13): 'Plph Vhphfgre Cebtenz'
hints: This uses ROT13 (rotation of 13)
Each letter is shifted by 13 positions in the alphabet
A becomes N, B becomes O, etc.

challenges.title: Base64 Decoding
hints: Base64 encoding is commonly used for data transfer
Use an online Base64 decoder
The result is a simple English phrase

challenges.title: RSA Key Analysis
challenges.description: Analyze this weak RSA implementation. Given p=17, q=19, and e=3, calculate the private key exponent d.
hints: Calculate n = p * q = 323
Calculate φ(n) = (p-1)(q-1) = 288
Find d where (e * d) mod φ(n) = 1
Use the Extended Euclidean Algorithm
